paper_abstract: This paper studies the peak-to-average power ratios (PAPRs) in multicarrier modulation (MCM) systems with seven different orthogonal bases, one Fourier base and six wavelet bases. It is shown by simulation results that the PAPRs of the Fourier-based MCM system are lower than those of all wavelet-based MCM (WMCM) systems. A novel threshold-based PAPR reduction method is then proposed to reduce the PAPRs in WMCM systems. Both numerical and simulation results indicate that the proposed PAPR reduction method works very effectively in WMCM systems. Copyright (C) 2006 John Wiley & Sons, Ltd.
paper_title: A study on the PAPRs in multicarrier modulation systems with different orthogonal bases
